list_definition.definition: to lose control of (oneself), act in an undignified manner

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She forgot herself and criticized her boss during the company party.

list_ex_of_english: At the least, the par tial exhumation demonstrates that the ancestor buried therein had not been forgotten.
Nevertheless, it should not be forgotten that those who aspired to be diplomats and journalists received a middle-school education.
Furthermore, although artists or song titles may have been forgotten, the lyrics were more often remembered, and many were able to sing along.
At the same time it should not be forgotten that these statements are only half the story.
However, along with this focus on the micro level consequences of unemployment, researchers have largely forgotten about the role of state intervention in relieving unemployment.
An elderly woman, aged 72 years, had clearly forgotten that the practice was nurse-led.
At the same time, the influence of a diaphragm is such that the obtained turbulent flow "does not forget" the initial conditions.
The half of the actor who 'does not forget' himself is the knower, the half who 'becomes the character' is the feeler.
